Attention: Everyone
Posted By: Tanutrushna Panigrahi
---------------------------------------------------------
List(2) of Students to be Felicitated on 26 January, 2020
---------------------------------------------------------
During the Republic day celebration, on the 26 January , student achievers in co and extracurricular activities will be honoured by the Instititute as per our practice. Those involved in the Cyber Safety and Security Awareness Programme are also included in the event. Attached here are the lists. We expect all the names in the list all to be present during the Republic Day celebration. Inform us about your absence before Sunday by emails if you are unable to attend.

Attention: 6th Semester B.Tech. Computer Engineering and Information Technology
Posted By: Muktikanta Sahu
---------------------------------------
Regarding projects to be done in OS Lab
---------------------------------------
Report submission deadline: 28.01.2020 4:30 PM

Category: Review/Research Projects

You are required to deposit a prelimary report on your preferred topic.

Mention problem statement.

Brief description of methods available to solve that problem. 

Number of pages should be limited to 6 pages.

Title font: Times new roman 14 size bold

Subtitle font: Times new roman 12 size bold

Content Font: Times new roman 11 size regular

Submit a printed report duly signed by all the group members followed by date.

Category: Simulator Projects

You are required to deposit a prelimary report on your preferred topic.

Mention problem statement.

Brief description of the s/w tools and the algorithms/functions that need to be developed/implemented. 

Number of pages should be limited to 6 pages.

Title font: Times new roman 14 size bold

Subtitle font: Times new roman 12 size bold

Content Font: Times new roman 11 size regular

Submit a printed report duly signed by all the group members followed by date.

messages.text:
Attention: All the students of IIIT-Bh
Posted By: Venkata Sridhar T
---------------------------------------------
Disciplinary Committee Suggestions
---------------------------------------------
Dear Students,

 

It is advised to all of you to maintain the dignity and decency of the institute.

 

In a few recent observations, it is found that the dignity levels of few students are going worse, which reflects the prestige of the institution. It is the responsibility of all of us, to uplift the prestige of the institute and to retain it. Hence the following are advised to the students to follow. 

 

1. No PDA (Public display of affections) inside the campus.

---------------------------------------------
Words to our students.
---------------------------------------------
 

Dear Students,

                Hope all of you are doing well and are safe. Yes something around the world is spreading quickly to take off us from mother earth. But human’s bondage with this Mother Earth is too strong, until we are humans. Time will come and go; anyhow the same time will heal the problems as they arrived. My sincere request and advice to all of you is, be strong and improve immunity to fight against the spreading virus. At the same time this is the good opportunity that every one of us has to utilise it, to build bondage in families or to strengthen it, try to understand the pain of parents to save us from the outbreak. Further this time can be utilised to strengthen the areas in education where we were weak. Hope all is well. Be responsible and be safe. Take care, God Bless You.

 

Ever Yours

Sridhar..

Attention: Faculty members and students
Posted By: Office of the Director
---------------------------------------------
IDEAthon to generate and transform innovative ideas into viable solutions for the pandemic CORONA.
---------------------------------------------
Urgent attention required by AICTE Approved Institutions in connection with Fight CORONA IDEAthon | Calling Innovators & Startups | 27 & 28th March 2020.
Please spread this message among all your

COVID-19 is spreading rapidly at an unprecedented scale across continents and has emerged as the single biggest risk the world has faced in modern times. Only science and technology in the hands of capable scientists and innovators can come to our rescue in developing innovative but effective solutions as we prepare for a future, which in the very short term looks increasingly uncertain.

MHRD Innovation cell & AICTE in partnership with Forge & InnovatioCuris have launched the national level 2 Day FightCorona IDEAthon soliciting innovative solutions from student innovators, researchers and educators. 1000s of innovators, researchers, scientists, and educators from across India are joining hands like a true community for this 2-day online IDEAthon to generate and transform innovative ideas into viable solutions that can support the community in managing the uncertainties arising out of the pandemic.

The program shall be hosted completely virtual on the internet during which several ideas to fight the COVID-19 pandemic shall be evaluated, mentored, documented, and selected for the next stages of incubation support. The participants shall go through a rigorous process of idea validation, refinement, solution generation and evaluation, pitching and assessments, to find the most innovative and impactful ideas which will be recognised with cash prizes worth Rs.2,0,00,00 from AICTE for students & educators separately.

As a Program Sponsor, AWS shall provide the winning team to award with USD 5000 as cloud credits to build the solution and take it to market & INR 5 lakhs as prize money to the winning teams.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
STUDENT INNOVATORS, EDUCATORS, RESEARCHERS, TECH PROFESSIONALS & STARTUP FOUNDERS

Do you have an idea to solve the challenge?

LAST DATE TO APPLY: 26th MARCH 12:00 pm
Win Cash Prize worth ₹ 7 Lakhs
Selected participants shall be considered for innovation grants up to ₹ 40 Lakhs, funding & incubation support.

For more details, visit

Attention: All
Posted By: Office of the Director
---------------------------------------------
Lock down to reduce the risk of Corona Virus 
---------------------------------------------
Further to the earlier communication, I am directed to inform you that due to lock down  situation  following arrangements  of the Institute will continue till 14th April 2020 or further communication.


 All classes are suspended, however online classes will continue.
 Faculty , staff and Research Scholars  remaining out of campus need not to come to the Institute. They may be  contacted or called for  if needed.
 Staff of essential services staying inside the campus are requested to avoid going outside.
 Canteens are requested to continue with minimum staff.
 Research Scholars may contact their Supervisors / Guide over phone/ as per their instructions.  
 No outsiders will be allowed to come inside the Camps.
 All are requested to obey Govt. guidelines.


 Faculty, Staff, Research Scholars and Students may donate to Chief Minister’s Relief Fund.

Attention: Everyone
Posted By: Pradyut Kumar Biswal
---------------------------------------------
Safe India Idea Contest and hackathon 
---------------------------------------------
"SafeIndiaHackathon is an online Idea Challenge & Hackathon being organized by Electropreneur Park Bhubaneshwar, a Centre of Excellence in ESDM by STPI, to find solutions to issues in these difficult times of

-19). The challenge is looking to identify and support solutions which shall enable us to face the difficulties of the lockdown, innovative preventive/corrective healthcare solutions and handling of unforeseen situations due to this pandemic ." This text to be addded under the heading "Safe India hackathon "

Focus Areas

Contactless detection or diagnostic product for Corona.

Developing devices and gadgets to support Social Distancing and Isolation.

COVID 19 Health monitoring devices.

Tangible solutions to stop spread of infection.

Risk assessments and surveillance devices.

Solutions for detecting violation of Social distancing norms and guidelines.

User friendly Sanitation/Disinfection Tech-solutions at public places.

Effective Quarantine monitoring and notification.

Personal Protection Equipment and gadgets for healthcare professionals.

Monitoring of other animals and assets adversely affected.

Enhancing preparedness and efficiency in dealing with post lock down situation.

Any other area which calls for technology and hardware-based solutions.

Visit the following link for more detail information:

Attention: B.Tech and M.Tech. Students
Posted By: Ais Admin1
---------------------------------------------
Reopening of the Institute on 31st May 2020
---------------------------------------------
In view of the prevailing condition arising out of the outbreak of COVID-19 in the country, the students may note the following:

 

ul
 
 The Institute shall remain closed for students till 31st May 2020.
 
 
 The students are required to report in the Institute on 31st May 2020.
 
 
 The academic activities including remaining classes, examinations shall be conducted from 1st June 2020.
 
 
 There will be no summer break in this year.
 
 
 On-line classes using Google Meet shall continue till the on-campus classes commence.
 
 
 The revised academic calendar shall be communicated soon.
 
 
 The students are advised to make their travel plans accordingly.
 
 
 The students are advised to check the notice board on M-UMS from time to time. 
 
 
 However, this schedule may change based upon directives from the Government.

Attention: Faculty,Staff, Research scholars
Posted By: Office of the Director
---------------------------------------------
Extension of Lockdown period 
---------------------------------------------
This has reference to the earlier notice dt 27th March 2020 by the Office of the Director.  The lock down period of the Institute is extended till 3rd May 2020 (day included) or further communication.


 
 Faculty, staff and Research Scholars  remaining out of campus need not to come to the Institute. They may be  contacted or called for,  if needed.
 
 
 Staffs of essential services staying inside the campus are requested to avoid going outside.
 
 
 Canteens are requested to continue with minimum staff.
 
 
 Research Scholars may contact their Supervisors / Guide/ Coordinator over phone/ as per their instructions.  
 
 
 No outsiders will be allowed to come inside the Camps.
 
 
 All are requested to obey Govt. guidelines.
